The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #20581 (Don't make "in" parameters look like "out"/"in-out" parameters: pass by ref to const instead of ref to non-const b
Concept ACK.\nLight code review ACK 9a5468e6d9e851503bfda9ffa9f9d0995291e890.\nI found it a bit confusing that you pass the optional `CAmount` sometimes as reference sometimes a pointer.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
üêô This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

<sub>Want to unsubscribe from rebase notifications on this pull request? Just convert this pull request to a "draft".</sub>
Closing due to lack of interest.
This can be a one-liner: `output = next(o for o in tx["vout"] if o["scriptPubKey"]["addresses"][0] == addr)`
Can remove the comment which is redundant to the log statement?
This should assert the precise amount?

```suggestion
        assert_equal(Decimal(signed["fee"]), fee)
```

To get debug information on failure
Maybe, but that's a bit unreadable?
The type is STR_AMOUNT, not NUM
